src:
Galaxy S11 Bakal Pakai Kamera 108 Megapixel, Samsung?
05 Nov 2019, 21:45 by Anggoro Suryo Jati - detikInet


Foto: Reuters

Jakarta - Penerus sensor 108 megapixel yang dirilis oleh Samsung bersama Xiaomi pada Agustus lalu kabarnya bakal dipakai di lini Galaxy S11.Sensor 108 megapixel itu adalah Isocell Bright HMX, yang menjadi sensor kamera yang punya resolusi setinggi itu, tepatnya 1.2032 x 9.024 pixel. Menurut Ice Universe, penerus dari sensor ini kemungkinan besar bakal dipakai di lini Galaxy S11 mendatang, sementara sensor generasinya pertamanya bakal dipakai pertama oleh ponsel buatan Xiaomi.Sensor 108 megapixel generasi ke-2 tersebut kabarnya bakal mempunyai peningkatan di beberapa aspek ketimbang sensor generasi pertama. Utamanya adalah kemampuannya dalam memotret di kondisi kurang cahaya.Untuk pemotretan di kondisi ini, Samsung sebenarnya punya teknologi bernama Tetracell, yang dalam kondisi kurang cahaya akan menggabungkan empat pixel menjadi satu pixel, atau dengan kata lain, sebuah foto dengan resolusi 27 megapixel.Galaxy S11 diperkirakan akan diungkap ke publik sebelum gelaran Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2020 di Barcelona, Spanyol, 24 Februari 2020 mendatang, demikian dikutip detikINET dari Phone Arena, Selasa (5/11/2019).Sebelumnya rumor yang berkembang adalah Samsung mulai menggarap software yang bakal dipasang di Galaxy S11e, Galaxy S11, dan Galaxy S11+. Sementara pada Oktober lalu Samsung dikabarkan sudah memilih desain akhir dan opsi konfigurasi untuk ketiga ponsel tersebut.Sebagai informasi, Galaxy S10 dan Galaxy S10+ menggunakan sistem tiga kamera belakang, terdiri dari kamera utama 12 megapixel, kamera tele 12 megapixel, dan kamera ultrawide 16 megapixel. Sementara bulan lalu Samsung merilis Galaxy A70 yang menggunakan sensor kamera 64 megapixel, yang menjadi sensor dengan resolusi terbesar di ponsel Samsung sampai saat ini. Simak Video "Jatuh dari Langit, 'Satelit' Samsung Mendarat di Permukiman Warga"[Gambas:Video 20detik](asj/fyk)
text:
Galaxy S11 Will Use 108 Megapixel Camera, Samsung?
05 Nov 2019, 21:45 by Anggoro Suryo Jati - detikInet


Photo: Reuters

Jakarta - Successor to the 108 megapixel sensor released by Samsung with Xiaomi last August will reportedly be used in the Galaxy S11 line. The 108 megapixel sensor is the Isocell Bright HMX, which is a camera sensor that has such a high resolution, exactly 1,2032 x 9,024 pixels. According to Ice Universe, the successor of this sensor will most likely be used in the upcoming Galaxy S11 line, while the first generation sensor will be used first by Xiaomi-made phones. The 108th generation 108 megapixel sensor is said to have improved in several aspects than the first generation sensor. The main thing is its ability to take pictures in low light conditions. For shooting in these conditions, Samsung actually has a technology called Tetracell, which in low light conditions will combine four pixels into one pixel, or in other words, a photo with a resolution of 27 megapixels. Galaxy S11 expected to be revealed to the public before the mat Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2020 in Barcelona, Spain, February 24, 2020, as quoted from Phone Arena, Tuesday (11/05/2019). Previously the rumors were that Samsung was beginning to work on software will be installed on the Galaxy S11e, Galaxy S11 and Galaxy S11 +. While in October Samsung reportedly had chosen the final design and configuration options for the three phones. For information, the Galaxy S10 and Galaxy S10 + use a three rear camera system, consisting of a 12 megapixel main camera, a 12 megapixel telephoto camera, and a 16 megapixel ultrawide camera. While last month Samsung released the Galaxy A70 which uses a 64 megapixel camera sensor, which is the sensor with the largest resolution on Samsung phones to date. Check out the video "Falling from the Sky, Samsung's 'Satellite' Landed in a Community Settlement" [Gambas: Video 20seconds] (asj / fyk)
